Posts.Content: kimng313 wrote: Hi. I have an easily felt and hard lump that is about the size of half a marble on my left breast. When pressed upon, it gets sore and moves back and forth. My doctor referred me to an ultrasound & they found nothing. She kept saying I'm too young & there is nothing shown in my family history. However, it is still there after almost half a year. My doctor seems to refuse to go any further after seeing the result. I am just really worried. Please tell me if anyone ever had the same thing & let me know your opinion of what to do. Thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 17 years old with a left breast lump. kimng313 flash

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 07:50PM kimng313 wrote: @itsjustme10: Thank you for your reply! Well, it's been worrying me everyday as long as it's still in me ): And yes, I have also told my parents but they still think it's probably nothing. Since almost everyone is telling me that the chances are very very small for my age (the same exact thing my doctor said), then at what age, if it still would be there, should I get a look at it again?
Posts.Title: 17 years old with a left breast lump. kimng313 flash

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2012 08:33PM kimng313 wrote: I really appreciate your advices. I guess I'll just stop worrying & keep an eye out for any changes in shape or size. It's really nice to hear from someone who has so much more to say than just "you're too young & it's probably nothing". Thank you so much! :)
